ARMovingWindowFilter Class Reference

#import <ARMovingWindowFilter.h>

Properties

NSUInteger windowSize

Detailed Description

This is an abstract filter class, which implements a moving window that can be used by child classes to access a fixed number of previous inputs.

Member Function Documentation

- (ARFilterValue) filterWithSampleValues: (ARFilterValue *)  someSampleValues
sampleTimestamps: (NSTimeInterval *)  someSampleTimestamps
lastSampleIndex: (NSUInteger)  aSampleIndex
sampleCount: (NSUInteger)  aSampleCount 

Applies the filter function on the determined window. This should be overridden by a child class.

Parameters:
sampleValues the sampled values.
sampleTimestamps the timestamps corresponding to the timestamps.
lastSampleIndex the index of the most recent sample in the array. The previous sample is in index (sampleIndex-1) or at the end of the array if (sampleIndex == 0).
sampleCount the number of actually measured samples; this value is always smaller than windowSize.
Returns:
the filtered value.
- (id) initWithWindowSize: (NSUInteger)  windowSize  

Initialize a filter with a given window size.

Parameters:
windowSize the desired window size.
Returns:
the filter.

Property Documentation

- (NSUInteger) windowSize [read, assign]

The size of the window that will be stored; this many samples will be stored.
